title: HPI Spencer
content: The patient, a right-hand dominant children's social worker, presents for evaluation of left wrist pain. She states the pain is more bothersome than the masses and wakes her up at night. She has been evaluated by Dr. Ishimori and diagnosed with a left first dorsal compartment wrist cyst, left thumb MCP osteophyte, and bilateral conditions. She presents today for evaluation and treatment of left wrist pain and masses, noting pain that wakes her up at night and masses at the dorsal radial aspect of her left wrist and the dorsal ulnar aspect of her left thumb MCP joint. The masses were previously variable in size but have remained constant recently.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: On exam, left upper extremity skin is clean, dry and intact without anything by my diagnosis. There is a pea-sized mass over the first dorsal compartment. No tenderness or location over the mass. It is mobile and non-tender. Negative Finklestein, no pain with resisted thumb extension. There is a mass at the dorsal ulnar aspect of the thumb MCP joint that is non-mobile and very minimally tender. Excellent range of motion at the thumb MCP. No tenderness or location at the A1 point, no locking or catching.
